item.title: Report X-2024030402
item.description:
Report X-2024030402

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the ATLR facility a fiberboard box with sign of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles inside of a plastic bag. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a new declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030240
item.description:
Report E-2024030240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, nearby freight and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew then deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030216
item.description:
Report E-2024030216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, one (1) 40-pound bag of calcium peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to sweep up the released product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. HES personnel removed the damaged bag from the shipment and placed it into the same drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was dropped while being unloaded from the trailer causing 1 of the glass jugs to break. I was called to contain and clean the spill. Sand was put down to contain the spill and the package was put into a salvage drum and taken to the hazmat processing area. the sand was cleaned up and disposed of properly DescribePack: The glass jug shattered spilled all content DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was surround the box and and top of the fluid, it was swept and disposed of

item.title: Report X-2024030262
item.description:
Report X-2024030262

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was processed to be returned to the shipper for being an improper hazmat and was dropped from the non conveyable belt when be prepared to be loaded onto the trailer. Once dropped the lid became undone inside the box, it was left on its side, not respecting the orientation arrows, to leak out further than necessary. To clean up the spill, sand was put down to absorb the spill while the box was recovered and put into a salvage drum. DescribePack: The clips on the lid became undone on the side it dropped on DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Sand was used to absorb the spill and the box was retained in a salvage drum

item.title: Report E-2024030223
item.description:
Report E-2024030223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 quart of drain clean (UN1830) was released from a bottle due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and it was determined that the terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on-site and the SCMs approval. (1) 5 gallon DF contains empty plastic bottle with oil dry was containerized and created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
